resources.string: It is any object, material, substance or solid element resulting from the consumption or use of a good in domestic, industrial, commercial, institutional, service activities, that the generator abandons, rejects or delivers and that is capable of being used or transformed into a new well, with economic or final disposal value. Solid waste is divided into usable and non-usable.
Any material, object, substance or element that has no value for the person who generates it, but can be incorporated back into a production process.
Any material or substance that does not offer any possibility of use, reuse or reincorporation to a production process. They have no commercial value, therefore they require final disposal.
They are those that have the characteristic of being able to disintegrate or degrade quickly, transforming into another type of organic matter. Example: The remains of food, fruit, husks, meat, eggs.

It is that residue or waste that due to its corrosive, reactive, explosive, toxic, flammable, infectious or radioactive characteristics can cause a risk to human health and the environment. Likewise, containers, packages or packaging that have been in contact with them are considered hazardous waste or waste.

Solid waste that, due to its quality, quantity, magnitude, volume or weight can present dangers and, therefore, requires special handling. It includes waste with expired consumption periods, waste from establishments that use dangerous substances, sludge, bulky or heavy waste that, with authorization or illegally, are managed together with municipal solid waste.

It is the place technically selected, designed and operated for the controlled final disposal of solid waste, without causing danger, damage or risk to public health, minimizing and controlling environmental impacts and using engineering principles, for the confinement and isolation of waste solids in a minimum area, with compaction of waste, daily coverage of the same, control of gases and leachate, and final coverage.

Post-consumption is an environmental task that consists of delivering hazardous and special waste to manufacturing companies through the post-consumer program in order to guarantee its proper collection, treatment and final disposal.

It must be taken into account that post-consumer waste must be separated from ordinary waste and managed in an environmentally appropriate way. For this there are collecting companies such as LÃºmin (bulbs and fluorescent tubes), Recoenergy (lead acid battery), Recopila y Batteries with the environment (domestic batteries), Green Network and Eco Computo (electronic devices), Blue Point (medicines) among others. , which have specialized containers to collect this waste and we can find it in chain stores, drug stores, state entities or at the same points of sale.

To make the separation from the source of solid waste, it is necessary to separate it in such a way that it is not contaminated with other waste, being essential that the materials are always clean and dry.
In the case of containers containing liquids, it is advisable to drain to avoid spilling its content on other materials.
Glass or plastic containers that store chemicals or that were in contact with them should not be disposed of with the usable material, since they are considered hazardous waste.
Papers impregnated with paraffin, black smoke, grease, oil, plastic coating, satin finish and aluminum are harmful to the recycling process and can contaminate other materials.

It implies reducing the production of garbage, which means that when acquiring a product it must be strictly necessary, as well as requiring objects that have few wrapping or packaging, avoiding those elements that will soon become garbage.
- Use products that have a minimum of packaging.
- Avoid the purchase and use of disposables.
- Use washable containers for food, and thermos for drinks.
- Avoid containers made of mixed materials.

It involves making the most of the waste that is thrown (plastic bags, containers, disposables, clothing, etc.), using waste as an essential material for the development of new products, in order to reduce waste, like many of these. The products could be reused again in different ways.
- Reuse plastic containers or any type of elements giving a new utility.
- Use the sheets of paper on both sides.
- Repair deteriorated or damaged items, preventing them from being thrown away.
- Giving away items that you no longer use to other people "one person's trash is another's treasure."
It is the process by which the recovered solid waste is used and transformed and its potential for reincorporation is returned to the materials as raw material for the manufacture of new products.
- Carry out the adequate separation of waste at the source.
- Instill others to practice separation at the source.
We contribute to the preservation of the environment by reducing the amount of waste that is sent to the sanitary landfill, lowering the levels of contamination caused by solid waste.

It reduces the use of non-renewable resources such as fossil fuels and minerals used for the generation of plastics, glass, aluminum, among others. As well as renewables such as trees for the manufacture of paper and water, it is used in most industrial processes.
It gives an economic value to the waste we generate, since it costs less to recycle than to manufacture a new product. By recycling we save water, energy and raw materials.

Recycling can promote many jobs, since a large workforce is needed to collect and classify materials suitable for use, generating income for many families and improving their socioeconomic conditions.
It is the action of classifying the waste in bags or containers at the generation site for its subsequent handling, either for use or final disposal.

Cardboard and paper (sheets, folding, newspaper, folders), Glass (Bottles, containers), Plastics (bags, PET containers, lids), Metal waste (scrap, lids, containers), Tetrapak composite packaging (milk boxes, juice boxes , liquor boxes).

Tissue paper (toilet paper, wet cloths, diapers, hand towels, sanitary napkins, panty liners), Waxed, laminated and metallized papers, Ceramics, Flat glass, Bones, Sweeping material, Cigarette butts, Dirty packaging and packaging materials , Cooked food scraps.
Uncooked food waste, Cutting and pruning of plant materials, Leaf litter
What is a usable organic waste?
They are materials resulting from the sweeping of the streets.
Element that quickly decomposes and becomes organic matter.
Material or utility object that does not offer any utility.
Material or object that we dispose of, but can be recycled.

Material or object that does not offer any utility.
Material or object that we dispose of, but that can be recycled.
Any material that pollutes the environment.
A condition to deliver a usable material is?
Which are impregnated with grease and oil.
